item.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 241 - 180 (Roll no. 181). (text: CR H1852)
Passed/agreed to in House: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 241 - 180 (Roll no. 181).(text: CR H1852)
The previous question was ordered without objection. (consideration: CR H1859)
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 170.
Considered as privileged matter. (consideration: CR H1852-1860)
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 18.

With respect to each measure, the resolution provides that the amendment in the nature of a substitute recommended by the Committee on Financial Services now printed in the bill shall be considered as an original bill for the purpose of amendment and shall be considered as read. The resolution makes in order only those amendments to the committee amendment printed in Parts A and B of this report. Each such amendment may be offered only in the order printed in Parts A and B of this report (except that amendment number 9 and amendment number 10 in Part B may be offered only en bloc). The resolution waives all points of order against the amendments printed in Parts A and B of this report.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 112-34, by Mr. Sessions.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 112-34, by Mr. Sessions.

summary.text: Sets forth the rule for consideration of the bill (H.R. 839) to amend the Emergency Economic Stabilization act of 2008 to terminate the authority of the Secretary of the Treasury to provide new assistance under the Home Affordable Modification Program, while preserving assistance to homeowners who were already extended an offer to participate in the Program, either on a trial or permanent basis; and providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 861) to rescind the third round of funding for the Neighborhood Stabilization Program and to terminate the program.

bill.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 839) to amend the Emergency Economic Stabilization Act of 2008 to terminate the authority of the Secretary of the Treasury to provide new assistance under the Home Affordable Modification Program, while preserving assistance to homeowners who were already extended an offer to participate in the Program, either on a trial or permanent basis; and providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 861) to rescind the third round of funding for the Neighborhood Stabilization Program and to terminate the program.

Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 839) to amend the Emergency Economic Stabilization Act of 2008 to terminate the authority of the Secretary of the Treasury to provide new assistance under the Home Affordable Modification Program, while preserving assistance to homeowners who were already extended an offer to participate in the Program, either on a trial or permanent basis; and providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 861) to rescind the third round of funding for the Neighborhood Stabilization Program and to terminate the program.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
